signal_description: Select the case ID, company code, company code description, customer number, invoice number, fiscal year, document type, cash discount classification, invoice amount in USD, invoice amount in document currency, currency key, amount eligible for cash discount in document currency, cash discount amount in document currency, amount eligible for cash discount in USD, cash discount amount in USD, G/L account number, invoice date, posting date, clearing entry date, clearing date, whether cash discount is available, baseline date, terms of payment key, last cash discount due date 1, last cash discount percentage 1, last cash discount due date 2, last cash discount percentage 2, net due date, total cycle time, average time from invoice creation to posting, average time from posting to clearing, number of days paid late from the defaultview-529 table where the invoice number and clearing date are not null, ordered by the invoice amount in USD in descending order.
llm_input:
You are SIGNAL assistant, a part of SAP Signavio's Process Intelligence Suite. 
SIGNAL stands for Signavio Analytics Language. 
SIGNAL is a dialect of SQL.
Your goal is to help users craft SIGNAL 
queries and understand the SIGNAL language better. 

Task to solve:

Summarize the given SIGNAL query as a human-readable description with explicit reference to the table name,
the column names and respective values if they are used in the Signal query.
Summarization style should look like a set of the instructions written by human who knows the table name, columns schema and respective values. 
Explain how this signal_description was constructed.

SIGNAL query: 
SELECT
  case_id,
  "Inv. Company Code" AS "Company Code",
  "Inv. Company Code Text" AS "Company Code Description",
  "Last Inv. Item Customer Number" AS "Customer Number",
  "Inv. Accounting Document Number" AS "Invoice Number",
  "Inv. Fiscal Year" AS "Fiscal Year",
  "Inv. Document Type Text" AS "Doc Type",
  CASE WHEN "Inv. Amount Eligible for Cash Discount in Document Currency" <> 0.00 
  THEN 'Cash Discount available'
  ELSE 'No Cash Discount' 
  END AS "Cash Discount Classification",

  "Inv. Converted USD Amount" AS "Invoice Amount in $",
  "Inv. Amount in Document Currency",
  "Inv. Currency Key",
  "Inv. Amount Eligible for Cash Discount in Document Currency",
  "Inv. Cash Discount Amount in Document Currency",
  "Inv. Converted USD Amount Eligible for Cash Discount",
  "Inv. Converted USD Cash Discount Amount" AS "Cash Discount Amount in $",
  "Last Inv. Item G/L Account Number" AS "G/L Account Number",
  --  all date fields
  "Inv. Date" AS "Invoice Date",
  "Inv. Posting Document Date" AS "Posting Date",
  "Last Inv. Item Clearing Entry Date" AS "Clearing Entry Date",
  "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" AS "Clearing Date",
  
  CASE
    WHEN "Last Inv. Item Cash Discount Percentage1"  != 0 THEN 'Yes'
    ELSE 'No'
  END AS "CD Available?",
  
   "Last Inv. Item Baseline Date",
   "Last Inv. Item Terms of Payment Key",
  "Last Inv. Item Cash Discount Due Date 1"  AS "Last CD Due Date 1",
   "Last Inv. Item Cash Discount Percentage1" AS "Last CD Percentage 1",
  "Last Inv. Item Cash Discount Due Date 2"  AS "Last CD Due Date 2",
  "Last Inv. Item Cash Discount Percentage2" AS "Last CD Percentage 2",
  "Last Inv. Item Due Date" AS "Net Due Date",
  -- aggregated KPIs
  AVG(
    (
      SELECT
        LAST(END_TIME)
    ) - (
      SELECT
        FIRST(END_TIME)
    )
  ) AS "Total Cycle Time",
  AVG("Inv. Posting Document Date" - "Inv. Date") AS "Avg time Invoice Creation to Posting",
  AVG(
    "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" - "Inv. Posting Document Date"
  ) AS "Avg time Posting to Clearing",
  AVG(
    "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" - "Last Inv. Item Due Date"
  ) AS "No. of days paid late"
FROM
  "defaultview-529"
WHERE
 "Inv. Accounting Document Number" IS NOT NULL
 AND "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" IS NOT NULL
ORDER BY
  15 DESC 
 
Expected output result is in JSON format:
{
"signal_description": text of the Signal summary should be here
}
Do not output any other text, apart from the above JSON.
